image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Bernie Sanders says Biden may not be ideal but he should be the candidate. Explains
item.description: ​"I strongly disagree with Mr. Biden on the question of U.S. support for Israel’s horrific war against the Palestinian people. The United States should not provide Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing extremist government with another nickel as it continues to create one of the worst humanitarian disasters in modern history," Bernie Sanders wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump worried people would find truth of Project 2025, says estranged niece
item.description: ​Donald Trump's estranged niece Mary Trump said her uncle was simply lying when he said he did not know anything about Project 2025. "...for somebody who 'knows nothing', Donald seems quite worried that we're going to find out the truth," Mary wrote. Project 2025 is a 900-page document proposed policies for e future Republican administration but Trump has distanced him from it.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli airstrike aimed at Hamas military chief kills at least 90 Palestinians in Gaza humanitarian zone
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Melania may remain reluctant but won't end her marriage with Donald Trump'
item.description: Former first lady Melania Trump may remain reluctant and largely missing from Donald Trump's campaigning but this does not hint at any rift between them and Melania will not end her marriage with Trump. Trump's marriage with Melania is the longest for Trump -- his marriage with Ivana lasted for 15 years, with Marla Maples around five years and with Melania 19 years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tulsi Gabbard says Biden not calling the shots, neither Jill, Hunter are
item.description: Former Democratic Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard said the Democrats are squabbling over Joe Biden because they don't care about the country. "They didn't give Democrat voters in that primary an option, but here we find ourselves, as we see all of this inner squabbling happening amongst Democrats and influential people in the Democratic sphere about whether or not Joe Biden should remain the nominee or whether they should swap him out and you look at why this infighting is happening. It's because they don't really care about what's best for the country," Tulsi said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Biden's gaffes are not because of age...': Jill Biden's ex-husband has a theory
item.description: Jill Biden's ex-husband Bill Stevenson has offered a theory that Biden's gaffes have probably more to do with the "lies" than his age. The "lies" they said about their relationship over the years have made 81-year-old Joe forget what's real and what's not, Bill Stevenson has claimed as Biden's failing health is on the radar amid his series of gaffes ahead of the presidential election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bill Maher has this prediction for Joe Biden: 'By August 9...'
item.description: Political commentator and comedian Bill Maher is certain that Joe Biden is not going to be the Democrat candidate. And he has a very specific prediction that Joe Biden would make the historic decision to opt out of the race by August 9. “The issue with President Biden isn’t if, it’s who,” Maher said during Friday’s airing of “Real Time with Bill Maher.” “Who will replace him? Because he is not going to be the Democrats’ candidate for president in 2024, all due respect.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia can counter US missile deployments in Europe, Kremlin says
Pakistan court acquits ex-PM Imran Khan, wife in unlawful marriage case, lawyer says
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Things to know about heat deaths as a dangerously hot summer shapes up in the western US
Princess of Wales Kate Middleton to attend Wimbledon men's final in London
item.description: The Kensington Palace office has announced that Kate Middleton, the Princess of Wales, will attend the Wimbledon Men's final in London on Sunday. This marks her second public appearance following a surgery she underwent six months ago, which led to the discovery of her cancer diagnosis. At 42 years old, the princess is undergoing preventative chemotherapy treatment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 27 dead, 15 missing as Indonesia ends landslide search
item.description: Indonesian rescuers halted their search after heavy rain in Sulawesi's Bone Balango caused a landslide near an illegal gold mine, killing 27 and leaving 15 missing. Weather and damaged bridges hampered efforts led by Heriyanto. Consulted families included missing miners and stall operators. Hundreds of police and soldiers participated in the search.

item.title: Fire at a Russian oil depot as Russia and Ukraine exchange drone attacks
UK police arrest man over discovery of human remains on bridge
item.description: British police arrested a 24-year-old man in Bristol following the discovery of human remains in two suitcases on the Clifton Suspension Bridge. The suspect, who traveled from London, will be questioned there. The remains were identified as two adult males. A second suitcase was found nearby. Police do not seek additional suspects. Local communities are reassured as inquiries continue.

item.title: Conservative group behind Project 2025 floats conspiracy idea that Biden could retain power by force
Amid ongoing war with Hamas, Israel plans to extend compulsory military service for men
item.description: Israel plans to extend compulsory military service for men from 32 months to 36 months, with a vote scheduled for Sunday. If approved, this extension will last for eight years amid the ongoing war with Hamas and debates over ultra-Orthodox draft legislation. Critics argue this move unfairly burdens current soldiers and allows many Haredi men to avoid military service.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian assassination plots against those supporting Ukraine uncovered in Europe, official says
'Cosmic ballet': Nasa unveils stunning images of two galaxies merging in Space
item.description: NASA unveiled James Webb Space Telescope’s breathtaking images of two galaxies, known as the Penguin and the Egg, located 326 million light-years away in Hydra. This release celebrates Webb's second anniversary of scientific results, showcasing its ability to explore early universe formation and future cosmic discoveries. The galaxies together are known as Arp 142.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk
